availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Follmer (Louisville, Kentucky, teamster and grocer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, teamster and grocer. Germany native. Married to Phoeba Follmer. Father of Catherine Follmer, Elizabeth Follmer, Rachael Follmer, Louisa Follmer, and Philapina Follmer. Teamster in Louisville in 1850. Grocer in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 1, p. 72B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 1, p. 20.
Find A Grave, "Philip Follmer (1816-1868)," Memorial #21461980, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21461980 (accessed December 27, 2018).
